#Text=Canupa Gluha
#Text=Mani speaks about Lakota Oyate , Lakota freedom
#Text=Wednesday , January 9 , 2008

#Text=It 's now been three weeks since the four-person Lakota Freedom Delegation declared that the Lakota people were withdrawing from their treaties with the United States and , though small , the movement still proves controversial : two U.S.-recognized Lakota tribal governments have rejected the Delegation 's authority outright with at least one tribe stating it will consider the Delegation 's , now Lakota Oyate 's , proposal .
#Text=The rest of the tribes have remained silent .

#Text=The central figure the movement has been Canupa Gluha Mani , a longtime activist whose tactics have led repeatedly to his arrest and imprisonment — most recently in June 2007 , when Canupa Gluha Mani was one of six arrested who participated in blockading a road in Nebraska to keep outside alcohol from entering his dry reservation where it is banned .
#Text=Wikinews
#Text=talked to Canupa Gluha Mani about the movement and Lakota Oyate in an exclusive interview .
#Text=File : Canupa Gluha Mani sings . jpg
#Text=Canupa Gluha Mani ( left ) at the Lakota Freedom Delegation 's December press conference in Washington .
#Text=Russell
#Text=Means is in the background .
#Text=Image : Naomi Archer . ( Image missing from commons : image ; log )

#Text=Also called Duane Martin Sr , Canupa Gluha Mani prefers to be referred to as just that , " Canupa Gluha Mani " ; it means " He walks as he protects the pipe " , though much of the meaning is lost in translation between English and the delicately-nuanced Lakota language .

#Text=Canupa Gluha Mani prefers to speak in this , his native tongue — he " hates " that the English language has become the everyday language of the Lakota , and decries the extinction of many indigenous American languages — but uses English fluently and earthily .
#Text=Canupa Gluha Mani talked about the Cante Tenza , the Strong Heart Warrior Society , which he heads and which forms the paramilitary force of Lakotah .
#Text=The society , an okolakiciye or warrior society , originated in the Black Hills .
#Text=He told the following story : Four warriors in the hills ran across a coyote and gave it chase .
#Text=And as the coyote ran he turned into a Lakota man , and in his changing the man left four objects : a rattle , a drum , a lance , and a tomahawk with which the Lakota people could be defended .

#Text=Canupa Gluha Mani is a warrior leader , and his position with relation to the treaty council which traditionally governs the Lakota is " whip-man " , loosely " sergeant at arms " — that is , he enforces order and decorum when passions grow heated during tribal discussions .

#Text=The authority of the Lakota Freedom Delegation , he says , comes not from the BIA -recognized governments but rather from the " people who understand treaties " , i.e. the treaty council , from among the Seven Sister Bands of the Lakota .
#Text=This traditional government is based on the idea of " staying quiet and listening to the people who have answers " , the " itacans " or expert headmen .
